oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Copper powder flask
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jefferson Casey Savage, who served under Gen. Nathan Bedford Forrest during the Civil War, carried this copper powder flask with a shell pattern. Savage was from Hardeman County, Tenn. According to family records, Savage joined Capt. Wilson's company in 1862, then transferred to Capt. Wiley Higgs' 2nd Co. K, 3rd (Forrest's Old) Tenn. Cav., CSA, formerly Higgs' Independent Scouts. Savage took the oath of allegiance to the United States and gave a $2000 bond on August 19, 1862.
